metadata.description:
The data set contains the observation data of meteorological elements from the Huazhaizi Desert Steppe Station,,which is located along the middle reaches of the Heihe Hydro-meteorological Observation Network, and the data set covers data from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014. The station is located in Huazhaizi of Zhangye, Gansu Province. The underlying surface is piedmont desert. The latitude and longitude of the observation point is100.3186E, 38.7652N, and the altitude is 1731m. The observation instruments in Huazhaizi are installed respectively by Beijing Normal University and Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Sciences. The observation instruments of Beijing Normal University are: two infrared thermometers installed 24 meters above the ground, facing south, with the probe vertical downward; soil temperature probes buried respectively at 0cm on the ground surface, 2cm、4cm、20cm、60cm and 100cmunder the ground; soil moisture sensors buried 4cm、20cm and 100cm under the ground; soil heat flow boards (3 pieces) buried 6cm under the ground. The observation instruments of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute are: wind speed sensor erected 10.48m、0.98m and 2.99m above the ground(3 layers),facing North; wind direction sensor erected 4 meters above the ground; air temperature and relative humidity sensors erected 1m and 2.99m above the ground(2 layers),facing North East; four-component radiometer installed 2.5 meters above the ground, facing South; barometric pressure sensor placed in the water-proof box; tipping bucket rain gauge installed 0.7 meter above the ground; soil temperature probes buried 4cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm and 50cmunder the ground; soil moisture sensors buried 2cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm、50cm and 58cm under the ground, 3 sensors buried at 2cm.
The specific observation elements are as follows:
(1) Observation elements of Beijing Normal University : surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watt / square meter), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_100cm) (unit: percentage) and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
(2) Observation elements of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute: wind speed (WS_0.48m, WS_0.98m, WS_2.99m) (unit: m/s), wind direction (WD_4m) (unit: degree), four-component radiation (DR, UR , DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor) (unit: watt / square meter), air temperature and humidity (Ta_1m, Ta_2.99m, RH_1m, RH_2.99m) (unit: Celsius, percentage), air pressure (Press) (unit: hectopascal), precipitation (unit: mm), soil temperature (Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_18cm, Ts_26cm, Ts_34cm, Ts_42cm, Ts_50cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_2cm_1, Ms_2cm_2, Ms_2cm_3, Ms_10cm, Ms_18cm, Ms_26cm, Ms_34cm, Ms_42cm, Ms_50cm, Ms_58cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage).
The observation elements of Beijing Normal University are 10-minute average data, and the observation elements of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute are 30-minute average data.
Processing and quality control of observation data: (1) Ensure 144 data of Beijing Normal University per day (every 10 minutes), and 48 data of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute per day (every 30 minutes). If there is missing data, it is marked as -6999. Data between 12.11-12.31,2014 is missing due to storage problems. (2) Eliminate moments with duplicate records; (3) Remove data that is significantly beyond physical meaning or beyond the measuring range of the instrument; (4) Data marked by red is debatable; (5) The formats of the date and time are uniform, and the date and time are in the same column. For example, the time is: 2014-6-10 10:30; (6) The naming rule is: AWS + site name.
For hydro-meteorological network or site information, please refer to Li et al. (2013). For observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是山前荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.3186E, 38.7652N，海拔1731m。花寨子站中分别有北师大、寒旱所的观测仪器。其中北师大的观测仪器具体架设为：两个红外温度计安装在2.65m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、20cm、60cm、100cm处；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下4cm、20cm、100cm处；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。寒旱所的观测仪器具体架设为：风速传感器架设高度为0.48m、0.98m、2.99m，共3层，朝向北侧；风向传感器架设在4m高处；空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在1m、2.99m，共2层，朝向北偏东侧；四分量辐射仪安装高度为2.5m，朝向正南；气压传感器放置于防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装高度为0.7m；土壤温度探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm和50cm处；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm、50cm和58cm，其中2cm埋设3个重复。具体观测要素如下：
（1）北师大观测项目：地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
（2）花寨子寒旱所观测项目：风速（WS_0.48m、WS_0.98m、WS_2.99m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_4m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor）(单位：瓦/平方米)、空气温湿度（Ta_1m、Ta_2.99m、RH_1m、RH_2.99m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、土壤温度（Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_18cm、Ts_26cm、Ts_34cm、Ts_42cm、Ts_50cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm_1、Ms_2cm_2、Ms_2cm_3、Ms_10cm、Ms_18cm、Ms_26cm、Ms_34cm、Ms_42cm、Ms_50cm、Ms_58cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。 
其中北师大观测要素为10min平均值，寒旱所的观测要素为30min平均值。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保北师大观测数据要素每天144个数据（每10min）；确保寒旱所观测要素每天48个数据（每30min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于数据存储的问题，在2014.12.11-12.31之间数据缺失；26cm土壤温度由于传感器探头的问题，出现较多错误值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波文比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关法（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的气温、风速、湿度，12米高度使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高度测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量使用位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 在异质表面上生态水文过程的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按层级嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how soil and canopy component temperatures are used in data collection methods for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个例子，说明土壤和树冠组件温度如何在异质景观的蒸散发估算数据收集方法中使用？
Example.AnswerEn: In the field of eco-hydrology, ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures are used in conjunction with a two-source energy balance (TSEB) model to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET). A high-resolution thermal camera captures thermal radiation images, which help in calculating soil and canopy component temperatures. These measurements are then validated using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance (EC) systems.
Example.AnswerCn: 在生态水文学领域，地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度与双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型结合使用，以估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET）。高分辨率热像仪捕捉热辐射图像，帮助计算土壤和冠层组分温度。这些测量结果随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差（EC）系统进行验证。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集异质表面生态水文过程的多尺度观测时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A major challenge in collecting multiscale observations for eco-hydrological processes is the poor availability of such data. To address this, the HiWATER experiment was designed with instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, to obtain comprehensive multiscale and multidisciplinary data in oasis-desert areas.
Example.AnswerCn: 收集生态水文过程的多尺度观测数据面临的一个主要挑战是数据的可用性较差。为了解决这个问题，HiWATER实验设计了分层嵌套尺度的仪器，包括涡度协方差塔和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，以在绿洲-沙漠地区获取全面的多尺度和多学科数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges do researchers face when collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 研究人员在收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据时面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Researchers face challenges such as the lack of multiscale observations and the complexity of capturing interactions in heterogeneous oasis-desert systems. The need for long-term and high-resolution data is critical for understanding these interactions and their impact on ecological stability and socioeconomic development. Additional challenges include ensuring data quality control, managing diverse data types from different observational platforms, and addressing environmental factors like advective conditions that affect measurement accuracy.
Definition.AnswerCn: 研究人员面临的挑战包括缺乏多尺度观测和捕捉异质绿洲-沙漠系统中相互作用的复杂性。理解这些相互作用及其对生态稳定性和社会经济发展的影响，迫切需要长期和高分辨率的数据。其他挑战还包括确保数据质量控制、管理来自不同观测平台的多样化数据类型，以及应对影响测量准确性的环境因素，如平流条件。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for soil temperature and moisture at the 花寨子荒漠站 compare to those used in the Daman superstation for estimating soil and canopy component temperatures?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 花寨子荒漠站的土壤温度和湿度数据收集方法与达曼超级站用于估算土壤和冠层成分温度的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: At the 花寨子荒漠站, soil temperature and moisture are measured using probes at various depths, with data averaged over 10-minute and 30-minute periods, depending on the institution. In contrast, the Daman superstation uses a high-resolution thermal camera to measure soil and canopy component temperatures, with observations taken as thermal images every 120 minutes. The Daman superstation includes a larger variety of instrumentation such as a four-component radiometer and eddy covariance system for more comprehensive measurement of thermal radiation and turbulent fluxes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在花寨子荒漠站，土壤温度和湿度通过不同深度的探头进行测量，数据根据机构的不同以10分钟和30分钟的时间段进行平均。相比之下，达曼超级站使用高分辨率热像仪测量土壤和冠层组件的温度，每120分钟拍摄一次热图像。达曼超级站还配备了更多种类的仪器，如四分量辐射计和涡度协方差系统，以更全面地测量热辐射和湍流通量。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in handling data quality control between datasets obtained from the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 and those from the HiWATER experiment?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验获得的数据与HiWATER实验获得的数据在数据质量控制方面有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset includes specific procedures for data quality control such as marking missing data with -6999, handling data record duplication, and removing outliers. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment emphasizes a comprehensive quality control process that covers sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation, ensuring data quality across various multiscale observations.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集包括特定的数据质量控制程序，例如用-6999标记缺失数据、处理数据记录重复和去除异常值。相比之下，HiWATER实验强调一个全面的质量控制过程，涵盖传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成，确保在各种多尺度观测中的数据质量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the methods of data collection impact the interpretation of soil and canopy temperatures in eco-hydrological studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 数据收集的方法如何影响生态水文学研究中土壤和冠层温度的解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The methods of data collection, such as using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, impact the interpretation by providing more accurate validation of E, T, and ET when combined with stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance measurements. High-resolution thermal cameras can improve the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, which is crucial for reliable energy balance estimations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 数据收集的方法，例如使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，通过与稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差测量相结合，提供了对蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET）更准确的验证，从而影响了结果的解释。高分辨率热像仪可以改善土壤和植被组分温度的分离，这对于可靠的能量平衡估算至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges do researchers face in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of multiscale observations in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在确保异质景观中多尺度观测的准确性和可靠性方面面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Researchers face challenges such as the limited availability of multiscale observations, classification errors in image data affecting component temperature accuracy, and the complexities of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes due to diverse landscapes and vegetation types. These challenges are addressed through hierarchical instrumentation and careful data quality control.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 研究人员面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的有限可用性、图像数据中的分类错误影响组件温度的准确性，以及由于多样的景观和植被类型而导致的捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性。这些挑战通过分层仪器和仔细的数据质量控制得以解决。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can datasets from oasis-desert systems contribute to understanding the carbon and water exchange processes in arid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集可以通过哪些方式帮助理解干旱地区的碳和水交换过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Datasets from oasis-desert systems provide long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which are essential for understanding the interactions between oasis and desert ecosystems. These datasets help maintain ecological balance and support sustainable development by offering insights into the carbon balance and water resource management in arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集提供了能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测，这对于理解绿洲和沙漠生态系统之间的相互作用至关重要。这些数据集通过提供对干旱地区碳平衡和水资源管理的见解，帮助维持生态平衡并支持可持续发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions using remote sensing data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用遥感数据在干旱地区准确估算蒸散发面临哪些挑战因素？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in accurately estimating evapotranspiration in arid regions using remote sensing data include the heterogeneous nature of the surface, the complex energy partitioning in soil and vegetation, errors in image classification, and the need for accurate component temperature measurements. Additionally, the strong advective environments and uncertainties in component temperature separation approaches contribute to these challenges.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，使用遥感数据准确估计蒸散发面临的挑战包括地表的异质性、土壤和植被中复杂的能量分配、图像分类中的错误，以及对各组成部分温度测量的准确性需求。此外，强的平流环境和组成部分温度分离方法中的不确定性也加剧了这些挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to achieve effective multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，针对异质表面实现有效的多尺度观测为何困难？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Effective multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies on heterogeneous surfaces are difficult due to the poor availability of multiscale data and the complexity of capturing interactions at varying scales. The need for hierarchically nested instrumentation and comprehensive data collection methods to address the diversity of processes across different landscapes also adds to the difficulty.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，由于多尺度数据的稀缺性以及在不同尺度上捕捉相互作用的复杂性，有效的多尺度观测在异质表面上是困难的。为了应对不同景观中过程的多样性，层次嵌套的仪器和全面的数据收集方法的需求也增加了这一难度。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间平衡的挑战是什么，以实现可持续发展？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable development arise from ecological environment degradation, such as drying up of water sources, vegetation degradation, and increasing desertification. These issues, especially prevalent in inland river basins, affect the sustainability and ecological stability of these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在可持续发展中，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡面临挑战，这些挑战源于生态环境的退化，例如水源干涸、植被退化和沙漠化加剧。这些问题在内陆河流流域尤为突出，影响了这些地区的可持续性和生态稳定性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of utilizing multi-scale observational data from the eco-hydrological sensor network in understanding oasis-desert interactions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用生态水文传感器网络的多尺度观测数据来理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing multi-scale observational data from the eco-hydrological sensor network can enhance the understanding of oasis-desert interactions by providing comprehensive insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes. This could support ecological security and sustainable development of oases, offering crucial information for achieving carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用生态水文传感器网络的多尺度观测数据，可以增强对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，提供关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程的全面见解。这可以支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展，为实现碳中和目标提供重要信息。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the integration of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers affect the accuracy and reliability of long-term energy and carbon flux data in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统与闪烁仪的集成如何影响干旱地区长期能量和碳通量数据的准确性和可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The integration of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers improves the accuracy and reliability of long-term energy and carbon flux data by providing detailed half-hourly measurements. These systems enable precise monitoring of turbulent fluxes, enhancing the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions, which is essential for addressing ecological and environmental challenges.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的结合提高了长期能量和碳通量数据的准确性和可靠性，提供详细的半小时测量。这些系统能够精确监测湍流通量，增强了对干旱地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解，这对于应对生态和环境挑战至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind establishing a multiscale observation system in eco-hydrological research within the oasis-desert regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区的生态水文研究中建立多尺度观测系统的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations by capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes through a hierarchically nested scale observation system, which is crucial for understanding oasis-desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过建立一个层次嵌套的尺度观测系统来应对多尺度观测稀缺的挑战，从而捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What objectives drive the long-term collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data in the oasis-desert ecosystems of the Heihe River Basin?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期收集能量、水汽和碳通量数据的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include achieving a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange to recognize oasis-desert interactions, support ecological security, and contribute to the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括实现对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，以认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，支持生态安全，并为这些生态系统的碳达峰和碳中和目标做出贡献。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the specific procedures for setting up and calibrating meteorological instruments in a hydrometeorological observation network in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区建立和校准水文气象观测网络中的气象仪器的具体程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments in a hydrometeorological observation network are arranged at hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. This includes installing automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) in different landscapes and ensuring careful quality control throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在水文气象观测网络中，仪器按层次嵌套的尺度排列，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括在不同景观中安装自动气象站（AMS），并确保在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成的整个过程中进行仔细的质量控制。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can researchers ensure the accuracy and reliability of soil and canopy temperature measurements in heterogeneous landscapes for evapotranspiration modeling?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 研究人员如何确保在异质景观中进行蒸散发建模时土壤和冠层温度测量的准确性和可靠性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Researchers can ensure accuracy by using a high-resolution thermal camera to observe soil and canopy component temperatures, applying the Craig–Gordon model for ET partitioning, and validating simulated radiometric temperatures against surface measurements. Errors due to image classification and atmospheric factors should be considered and managed.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 研究人员可以通过使用高分辨率热像仪观察土壤和冠层组分温度，应用Craig–Gordon模型进行蒸散发分配，并将模拟的辐射温度与地表测量进行验证，从而确保准确性。应考虑并管理由于图像分类和大气因素引起的误差。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What data processing and quality control procedures are implemented to maintain the integrity of long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux datasets in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，为了维护长期能源、水蒸气和碳通量数据集的完整性，实施了哪些数据处理和质量控制程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures include data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing. Observations are carefully controlled through sensor calibration and data processing steps, which include averaging turbulent flux data over 30 minutes and hydrometeorological data over 10 minutes, ensuring consistency and reliability in the datasets.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享。通过传感器校准和数据处理步骤，观察结果得到了严格控制，这些步骤包括将湍流通量数据平均处理为30分钟，以及将水文气象数据平均处理为10分钟，从而确保数据集的一致性和可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in eco-hydrological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在生态水文研究中能够准确分离土壤和冠层成分的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras and the application of the maximum-likelihood method for classifying soil and canopy pixels have enabled the accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures. This method involves converting thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation data and emissivities, thus enhancing the precision of soil and canopy temperature estimates in eco-hydrological studies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用以及最大似然法在土壤和冠层像素分类中的应用，使得土壤和冠层组件温度的准确分离成为可能。该方法涉及使用入射长波辐射数据和发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度，从而提高了生态水文学研究中土壤和冠层温度估计的精度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways do stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques enable more accurate validation of evapotranspiration components?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术以何种方式使蒸散发成分的验证更加准确？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques enable more accurate validation by providing precise measurements of the ratios of evaporation and transpiration to total evapotranspiration. These isotopic measurements can be used alongside eddy covariance system data to validate evapotranspiration estimates from models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, thus improving the reliability of evapotranspiration component separation and validation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 稳定的氧和氢同位素技术通过提供蒸发和蒸腾与总蒸散的比率的精确测量，使得验证更加准确。这些同位素测量可以与涡度协方差系统数据结合使用，以验证像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的蒸散估算，从而提高蒸散组分分离和验证的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of datasets used for modeling evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保在异质景观中用于建模蒸散发的数据集的准确性和可靠性的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenges include errors in image classification affecting component temperature estimation, uncertainty in the TSEB model, and the strong advective environment in irrigated agricultural areas. These factors contribute to inaccuracies in estimating the soil and canopy component temperatures, which are critical for reliable evapotranspiration modeling.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括图像分类中的错误影响组件温度估计、TSEB模型的不确定性以及灌溉农业区域强烈的平流环境。这些因素导致土壤和冠层组件温度估计的不准确，而这些温度对于可靠的蒸散发建模至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could data collection techniques be improved to better support sustainable oasis development and carbon neutrality goals?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 有哪些方法可以改进数据收集技术，以更好地支持可持续绿洲发展和碳中和目标？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Improving data collection techniques could involve enhancing multiscale observation capabilities, incorporating more precise remote sensing technologies, and developing robust models to better understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. These improvements would support sustainable oasis development and carbon neutrality goals by providing a clearer understanding of oasis-desert interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改善数据收集技术可以涉及增强多尺度观测能力、结合更精确的遥感技术，以及开发强大的模型，以更好地理解能量、水汽和碳交换。这些改进将通过提供对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的更清晰理解，支持可持续绿洲发展和碳中和目标。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in data collection for eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems and suggest potential methodologies to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在绿洲-沙漠系统中进行生态水文过程数据收集所面临的挑战，并建议克服这些挑战的潜在方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection for eco-hydrological processes include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in heterogeneous landscapes. Potential methodologies to overcome these challenges could involve the use of hierarchically nested scales for capturing multiscale processes, leveraging a combination of ground-based measurements such as eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and advanced remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imaging.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程数据收集面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差，以及在异质景观中测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换的复杂性。克服这些挑战的潜在方法可以包括使用分层嵌套尺度来捕捉多尺度过程，利用地面测量（如涡度协方差塔、自动气象站）与先进的遥感技术（如激光雷达和热成像）的结合。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please propose a strategy for expanding or refining datasets related to the estimation of evapotranspiration in arid regions using remote sensing and ground-based observations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提出一个策略，用于扩展或完善与干旱地区蒸散发估算相关的数据集，利用遥感和地面观测。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A strategy for expanding or refining datasets related to evapotranspiration estimation could involve integrating high-resolution thermal images obtained from thermal infrared cameras with ground-based measurements like soil and canopy component temperatures. This approach could improve the validation of evaporation and transpiration estimates by utilizing stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance systems. Additionally, implementing a robust quality control process during data collection and processing would enhance dataset reliability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一个扩展或细化与蒸散发估算相关的数据集的策略可以涉及将从热红外相机获得的高分辨率热图像与地面测量（如土壤和树冠组件温度）相结合。这种方法可以通过利用稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差系统来改善蒸发和蒸腾估算的验证。此外，在数据收集和处理过程中实施一个强有力的质量控制流程将增强数据集的可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please suggest an optimized data collection method for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert areas, considering both ground-based and remote sensing technologies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请建议一种优化的数据收集方法，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度生态水文过程，考虑到地面和遥感技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: An optimized data collection method could involve the establishment of a comprehensive observation network that includes flux measurement matrices with eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and advanced airborne remote sensing tools such as LiDAR and imaging spectrometers. This method should be designed to operate across multiple spatial and temporal scales, ensuring synchronized ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes to address the complexity of oasis-desert interactions effectively.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一种优化的数据收集方法可以涉及建立一个综合观察网络，包括涡度协方差塔的通量测量矩阵、自动气象站以及先进的航空遥感工具，如激光雷达和成像光谱仪。该方法应设计为在多个空间和时间尺度上运行，确保对植被动态和光合作用过程的同步地面测量，以有效应对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的复杂性。
